question: Who of the following has been sworn in as the new Costa Rican President?
explanation: Journalist Carlos Alvarado has been sworn in as Costa Rica's President, accepting the sash of office from his predecessor and ally, Luis Guillermo Solis. At 39, Alvarado is the country's youngest president in modern history. Although Costa Rica is one of the region's most stable economies, the Central American nation is struggling to get its deficit under control amidst a Fitch downgrade.
